intro: Psychotria constricta, commonly known as the "arrow poison plant," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking dark green, glossy leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant contains various alkaloids, including the psychoactive compound dimethyltryptamine (DMT), which has been historically used by indigenous peoples for ritualistic purposes. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
